title: VRC Gates are Kryptonite for Visual Odometry

content.raw:
The tiny visual grids on the VRC gates are terrible for Visual Odometry. See attached images.

A 101 on Stereo Vision:

 descriptors are extracted (i.e. patterns of color gradient)

 100s descriptors are matched in left and right to give X, Y, Z points

 Inlier sets of XYZ points describe the stereoscopic information in the image.

 these features are aligned successively to give an estimate of motion.

These algorithms are based on the work of Andrew Howard, amoungst others.

However step 2 fails terribly for the images showing the VRC gates. The tiny checkerboard pattern is sensed identically without noise - despite being tiny features. (Real sensor noise would mean that the grid wouldn't be visable in reality). So the descriptors find 1000s of points - every grid point. Then matching between left and right is hugely complicated.

The result is that the feature depths are often estimated incorrectly - see the red loops. Hence motion estimation fails.

**Please remove the grids and just have plain red, green and blue color.** They gain nothing other than to cause unrealistic failures of algorithms that are tried and tested in the real world.

Additionally, why are the walls in the VRC tasks all blank? E.g. for manipulation? Can this be improved
